gj15b1j8Z_-70TIqdyb81w.text: This was my first time visiting this restaurant. I'm new to the neighborhood and try to support local businesses in my area. I looked online and saw they had a happy hour deal until 6pm, with half-priced appetizers.  When we entered the restaurant, I told the hostess it was my first time and I wasn't sure if we needed to seat ourselves or wait to be seated. She said she'd seat us. I asked if they still had happy hour until 6 and she said yes. She took us to what I thought was the bar area and seated us in a booth. When the waiter came over with menus, I asked for the happy hour menu and he told me happy hour was still going on for 30 more minutes. I ordered wine and between my boyfriend and I, we ordered 4 different appetizers to try. Just before 6pm I ordered another glass of wine. I had a friend join us and encouraged her to also order something before happy hour ended and that is when the waiter informed us that we could only get happy hour if we were seated at the actual bar and not in a booth. Seriously, we were 10 feet from the bar and no one said anything about that until after we had ordered. Needless to say, we paid over $60 for appetizers and 2 glasses of cheap house wine. And that makes this the first and last trip to this restaurant for us. Two thumbs down!

B_YS8WCFFfjfshFhmZjJ2w.text: All dishes here are so mouthwatering  I love the pastas everything tastes fresh and homemade from the sauce to the pasta. Appetizers are great...the portions are amazing. The ambiance is family friendly but also nice for a night out with your significant other  the owner is very kind and will make sure you are treated very well. The staff is friendly. It's an overall great place to dine out. I highly recommend going here everything is great!!

qcyjDGmL1rsn0AYQSYyjtA.text: Super nice staff!  Good service, good food.  What else is there to say?  Not a five star only because it is crowded and a bit noisy.

06OzwPHkNOZazrsL3pcR0A.text: I recently went here with a friend for dinner and our server was Peggy, Peggy was very informative, fun to talk to and even sat down and BS'd with us, she's amazing!   The food here is phenomenal in every way, all taste great and look great!   The ambiance is a nice and relaxed Italian restaurant. The wine selection is very good too!!!

ZslUAd4jvXC4-KjNllSHLA.text: Got delivery through bite squad and it was great! Two salads (caesar and Mediterranean) and two pasta dishes (vodka sauce penne and spaghetti & meatballs) plus the Nutella cheesecake that was amazing! Highly recommend!

E2A6HmM72VcTy5Wsut1f8Q.text: Best real Italian food in all of las vegas. Highly recommended and newly renovated so there is room for the whole family. Very friendly staff

PmtS1lz-pFjFFy3XrU3ObQ.text: I loved this place best Italian food around!! Also the service was great.. I want back more then once and would recommend this place..

Arm-ikh86TLyoXJDBMrY-Q.text: So disappointed. There were 2 servers for the entire restaurant with more than 4 men bussing. Waited too long to be offered a glass of wine and order dinner. My lasagna sauce tasted like Chef boy ardee and the Tira Misu was served in a tiny plastic cup. The dinning experience was one I never wish to experience again. Loud and not intimate at all. When I say intimate I mean I could not hear myself or my dinning mate talk. Server paid more attention to his friends than us. As if we were irrelevant. If I pay 20 or more per person I want to be served and paid attention to. At least act like you care about your customers. Even if we aren't your friends. Never going back.

W8j06CrFyV1aCinjvhmoBw.text: WOW!  Best Italian I've had in Las Vegas. Hand made fresh pasta, great sauces!  Super daily specials!  Doesn't get any better than this.   The chef maintains a great menu with lots of choices.   In addition, they have an Italian deli with high quality items imported directly from Italy.

ZNDjXBnL45PelGLbAMQfvg.text: Great authentic Italian food. Fresh, high quality stuff and good portions. We ordered Cheese Ravioli with meat sauce, Gnocchi nini and Chicken piccata. Everything was amazing, juicy and flavorful. Food is also priced rite for this quality and portions...

xSjPbxIyBwGSrM-GkmQ3BA.text: I have to admit this place has exploded in size since the last time I was here. The service and food was amazing (I recommend the the chili spaghetti) 10/10. I will definitely be back.

Q0IYzLLuSb9eG7a3lGlbZA.text: They recently remodeled and it is our first time being back after it. They took their very good small deli and restaurant and turned it into a very amazing night out. Their food is still outstanding along with their service, and now it is the perfect place for a date night. They also have TVs so you can also watch a sports game.

_sg_5W9HY1EfHwzeAjF7Cw.text: This is by far the best Italian Restaurant in Las Vegas!  My husband David Marosi and I just love this place.  My grandparents are straight from Italy so I've been raised on good Italian food. Thus, making me a very picky eater of Italian food.  We have brought our friends here and they also loved it. My eggplant was cooked to perfection.  We love the owner and Lydia one of the chefs knows how to make a phenomenal sauce. We have never experienced bad service.  In fact, we get incredible 5 star service every time we have gone.  The restaurant has a great ambiance.  If in Vegas, you must try this restaurant.  You will not regret it.

F7qsxeG6LSR_UDm39omhHQ.text: After reading a review on a Facebook group, we decided to take the kids and check this place out, and let me tell you, we were not disappointed!!!   Ordered the Antipasto Misto. For dinner: Spaghetti Western,  Cioppino, Chicken Alfredo, and Pizza. For dessert, Cannoli's and Tiramisu  We have now found a new, close to home favorite!  The younger chef, you can tell has a lot of passion about his cooking.  Can't wait to go back and try something new!

pxkJRe_dXW2yaOmtvDkaRA.text: Absolutely amazing! Best Italian food I've ever had besides the east coast! Owner is awesome and is extremely friendly and approachable!

ZrvlJmo3atvjGz6wGDeoFQ.text: The Italian meatloaf is to die for!!!!! Great new owners and big thanks for the new soft chairs, my butt thanks you. Cheers

JAiH2MhV7rs0ZBSSBYVDjg.text: Very tasty food. Owner is Italiano & she has a great sense of humor. The food was outstanding. My first visit and I was completely impressed. Mangia Mangia

xWGEn_HpXva9uRV1AlPxqg.text: I love this place ... The Pasta is Great!!! One of the best I ever had... Is a small restaurants but huge plates...

t07isjG7yv-JRduTdbfRhQ.text: When it comes to Italian food I am hard to impress. Actually when it comes to any food I'm hard to impress...anyways...I LOVVVVE Spaghetty Western. I have dined in, taken out and used the delivery service. I stopped with deliveries and now just call an order in and pick it up because every single time we would order a delivery we had an issue. Two hour wait times, wrong items delivered etc. the worst was the wait. Every single time. The food is well worth leaving the couch. I don't think I've ate one bad thing here. The pastas, pizza, sandwiches, salads, cheese and meat platters are all so amazing. The Penne Pink Vodka is to die for and the portions are all worth the money you spend on them. Everything is shareable too. If you like Italian food you MUST check this place out, you won't be disappointed (unless you order delivery ;)).

maYuRKOb2IYmanQbJEvk3Q.text: Another great find . Real Italians making fresh pasta . The fresh portobello mushroom pasta was to die for. The meatball sub with home made meatballs was outstanding. Service was great as well as atmosphere .I highly recommend

wiegkqdFfDLuXWLTsF5Opg.text: My husband and I have been here three times now and they have yet to disappoint. The food is fabulous and the service is great. I love that you can tell how fresh everything is.

syTIh2LCbYeserrs3hkc8w.text: This place is fabulous - I felt like I was back in NY at a casual storefront restaurant. I had the chicken marsala & it was delicious. My husband enjoyed the spaghetti & meatballs.  The staff was very good & attentive - which may be because we were right next to the kitchen.  The place is very small but one of the owners said they are in the process of expanding.  The only reason I gave them a 4 is because the garlic bread appetizer was not very good - kind of tasteless.  We are definitely going back & bringing friends.

Xl0ckB8eVa5L3b5dpBNKmA.text: Amazing authentic Italian! The lobster ravioli and tiramisu are must haves!!!! Service is awesome

pVZbwr66isDpf__y_ie0Bw.text: I tried this restaurant for the first time and it was great I'll definitely be back! I dined in at lunch time and had a chicken parmigiana sandwich. It came out in a timely manner and was amazing. The huge portions left me stuffed!

oWnyTX9pLcZZoy5aAx12Tg.text: Food was not acceptable,  its an ok place last minute but you shouldn't expect much.   So, based on the reply from whomever responds to these reviews, my review was not detailed enough and I did an injustice to others and myself. Here you are: First point of contention, as for your request to voice my concerns while I was there, that in deed occur. Unfortunately, if there was a manager on duty, they didn't care enough to stop by and address our concerns.  All we got was, "I'll let someone know."  As for our concerns, the margherita pizza was over cooked and dry. The crust was burnt and the sauce was bitter. The same sauce used on the few bits of penne served with my chicken Parmesan. Which was so soggy from the inability to drain the water from said pasta. Due to the soggy breading on that dish, made it impossible to taste any flavor, even if there was any. The Caesar salad was more vinegar than anything. It left the romaine wilted and your attempt at homemade croutons was unsuccessful.    The service was lackluster at best. Never once did our server check on us after a course was dropped. And if there was a manager on duty, and you really wanted to know how your guests are faring, well then maybe you should show a presence on the floor. A decent restaurant manager would make a point to touch every table at least once. By not doing so and "managing" from the back is just lazy. That is doing others and YOURSELF a disservice. Your accusations to me of being petty and contrite are not only unprofessional, but unTrue.   You had a former restaurant manager of 15 years and a well known Chef, who has worked with some of the top chefs in the valley in your establishment that evening. Your inability to provide a modicum of a decent experience that night was YOUR fault, you failed as a restaurant and as a manager. With ALL of the eaterys in this town, especially in that shopping complex alone, I would have hoped you could have shown a little more respect for your locals. And instead of insulting me, maybe the better course of action would have been to attempt to contact me and we could have spoken about your shortfalls. You, unfortunately chose the low road.   I urge anyone who is thinking of dining in your establishment to reconsider. You'll get better food and service at Olive Garden. Good day to you!  I'm sorry David S.  I accidentally was logged in under a another persons' account. I re-posted under me so you could put a name with the review.  My purpose is not to discredit your establishment,  but to give an accurate account of my experience. I never stated I wouldn't be returning. I now feel compelled to return so we can sit down and talk face to face. This all seems too impersonal. Look forward to meeting you.

BzwdR6_rZFyFgQw-LoD90A.text: Hands down one of the best in town. A True gem in Southern Highlands. From the service to the food quality SW will not disappoint. Can't wait to go back!

FW0H6xr6dyjzWNrwYSodig.text: My husband and I had a great experience in this restaurant!  The food & Service was fantastic!!! Heather thank you!!! I would recommend this restaurant for sure!!!

fAK1Do6_3G4-wIWCjaXJcQ.text: Had heard decent things about this restaurant so decided to give it a try. Went there waited 20 minutes for a cocktail then another 15 minutes before the server came back to take our order. The food was mediocre at best and the price was ridiculously high for what we received. Would not recommend

cubAUXBUyKNpMN341XpTIQ.text: Update!!!!  Just got their liquor license!!!!!! Dinner just got better!  We love this place and so happy they just expanded! Order the Bobbi penne pasta. It's amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Parm

dK6mhBZUUVa_Rr30fT7MMg.text: This place is one of my favorite Italian Restaurants in Las Vegas. It's a little on the pricey side but it is worth it.  The pastas are delicious and the portions are really large!  You will usually have food tot take home.  I highly recommend the Baked Mostaccioli!   Not a very upscale or romantic Italian Restaurant. More of a nice place to eat with the family.

L39vKUwUXTYOfaHjzh1xVA.text: Lazy quick review:  A new go-to local Italian spot besides Nora's!  Awesome, quaint, little spot with cheeky spaghetti western deco!  Bobbi (add grilled chicken) = 10/10 super delicious! Would be a 9 without the chicken.   Carbonara = 9/10 I love a good carbonara and this place doesn't disappoint! Took off a point cause sometimes the onions don't cook down enough and some bites are too "onion-y"  Veal parmigiana = 9/10 large portion and not too greasy. Crust is nice and crispy, red sauce on spaghettii is flavorful!  Service is good, Alex served us a few times now and is always friendly. Sometimes we have to ask for the bread though, no biggie...  Nora's is slightly better albeit more expensive so that makes sense...

sBVW1iOXWDpPHJsYufR97g.text: Nice little place near mountains edge.  Anti pasta was awesome.  Pasta was good.  Great service and the deserts were very good.  Loved the octopus appetizer and it's a must order.  The balsamic glaze they have is awesome and they gave us a bottle for 5 bucks which was very nice of them.  We will be back for lunch again soon.

IxbTk11AOTXrv72-1h-WVQ.text: Silly name, excellent Italian food! This is what I love in a restaurant. Local ownership, great variety and some of the tastiest pasta gravies anywhere. Service is always friendly.

LSWp1wLbLhlbgJGX252Oqw.text: Today, we decided to stop in for a quick lunch. My wife loves the lasagna and I chose to order the lunch special. Portions on the lunch special were not altered to scale down size. I could not finish my meal because it was very filling. The food was excellent! The service by Robert Proby was only matched by our last visit when Johnny waited on our table. Robert was very attentive and right on top of our needs.  I spoke to the owner upon exiting and discovered we were raised near each other on the East Coast. This place is just like going home without the long flight.  I would highly recommend this establishment and encourage others to try them out. You will not be disappointed.

QVS_ZXnD2qBMDdS94LW6zg.text: We had take out for Valentines Day. To be fair it was take out and perhaps it is better in person because I know people do love this place. I just feel that the dishes we came home with were too Americanized. I am sad it is so hard to find an Italian restaurant who actually make their own pasta especially long pasta. That would make all the difference in the world.

hcjuE3ucQYDzT7aDs1WsZg.text: This is our favorite place to go for Italian food in the SW area. It took us two years of living right up the street to even realize what it was!  The food is excellent, but the ambiance and service is what really makes it awesome. The servers are always attentive and helpful. My wine glass is never empty and the food comes in perfect sequence.  We REALLY enjoyed a singer they had there one night who would seamlessly go from covers of 80s rock bands to modern pop... super cool. We have been back three times and will continue to visit in the future whenever we have a hankering for great pasta!

A6kv27ynmdkWfmLWMPjgjw.text: Ate lunch again here since it's close to my house.  Used groupon.  Saved some $.  Got the fettuccine bolognese and although it was decent, it was nothing great.  Bootlegger on Las Vegas BLVD is way better.     My dish was luke warm and i only live 5 mins away.  The flavors were ok and the portion size was good.    People are nice there n they have done a good renovation of the restaurant.   I will probably go back but only with groupon.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fettuccine bolognese for lunch.  This is half the size of the dish.  I split it with another person.  It was just ok.  3 stars

JTFtRcnnQQGq9qYPiY_JcA.text: Going to change my review and lower stars from 4 to 1. Service has gone downhill. Last time I was in to place a to go order I was ignored by cashier at front; ignored by bartender; then when I asked a waitress for a menu, she said menus were at the front with a wave of her hand (great customer service)--there were none; when I said there were no menus, I got an eye roll and and a huff and puff to get me a menu. I walked out.  Tonight my husband picked up 2 sandwiches and a pizza. Why does the menu say "toasted sub" and instead I get soft square bread? My husband also asked for no tomatoes on my sandwich and no onions on his sandwich. Guess what made it into the sandwiches--onions and tomatoes! My husband was also ignored by the bartender when tying to get some water. Apparently texting on her phone was more important. Totally obnoxious, lacking in customer service and rude. Bartender needs to get a grip. No thanks. I can spend my money elsewhere.

xawWKaornrZQtXdYYXs6vg.text: Found this place at yelp since we were craving for pasta. We arrived abd was seated promptly upon arrival. We for the lunch special and the server did not bother to ask if it was our first time. We had question and he seem to not want answer. We ordered the red vodka pasta and added shirmp and chicken for additional price from the lunch special, my husband order the alfredo fettuccine, which we both enjoyed our food. We also had calamari to start with and the daughters order cheese pizza. We finish out appetizer and was almost done with our pasta, apparently they burnt the cheese pizza and just happened to let us know when were already done with out food. They comp our pizza but they kids was not in the mood to eat since it took so long. I ordered a house wine cabernet since they have a special for $5 but when we recieve our check we were charge full price.  We tried to get the servers attention but was ignored so overall food was great but service was horrible.

YnoEDzxh4k0OoB2NzwIdwg.text: Our first visit to the restaurant, excellent service,food and you must ask for the server Clemente!

PkvWku_cJkpjOOPAi4yonQ.text: Came here last week for the first time, I ordered the lobster ravioli, my boyfriend ordered the Diovola. Both were AMAZING. I will order the Diovola next time though because I liked that a little more. The sauce on it is perfect. The lobster ravioli was super yummy with the shrimp. Our server ( bald guy with glasses) was AWESOME! Loved him  It's a far drive for me but I'll be back!

ov2tONjt-NawcBMgYSWILg.text: Amazing food served with even better service! Love having this hidden gem of a restaurant in Southern Highlands.  Seats fill up fast especially on a weekend. I recommend a reservation

cLXTDV7DvZWGyxOTH8Titg.text: Stumbled into Spaghetty Western a two years ago on a visit to LV from the east coast. The staff and the owner, David, make me feel very much at home. The food was great and the crowd at the bar was fun.  I have made a point of visiting Spaghetty Wester on all my trips to LV and haven't been disappointed . In fact, it keeps getting better and better!

0gKV34Cid51w6Eqj8tkliw.text: We visit Las Vegas no less than 3 times per year. We have our favorite places to eat and we look forward to going to them when we're there.  Spaghetty Western is our new favorite place.  I was looking on Yelp for a new restaurant to try, because we're staying in an unfamiliar part of town near SouthPoint.    I was curious about the name because there's a restaurant called Spaghetti Western in Houston, Texas that I've always wanted to try and haven't, yet.  I'm reading the reviews and they're all good, except one.  The best part of his review was the owner's reply. It was, bar none, the best reply. Ever. I had to try this restaurant because the owner took a stand for his staff. He earned my respect, before I stepped into his restaurant.  When we arrived (it's a Monday night, btw) it's bustling. We're a little surprised because it's in a shopping center, but inside it's a small intimate restaurant with a dessert case full of delicious looking treats, a bar and several tables.  We are greeted and seated almost right away.  We're near the bar at first and later moved to a booth.   Our waiter, the waitstaff and the manager provided excellent customer service. I am a stickler for customer service and Las Vegas is one of the most friendly places I've ever visited.   We got the toasted ravioli appetizer. Garlicky buttery ohmygoodness served with marinara.  I ordered the Eggplant Involtini.  My favorite Italian dish that is almost never on a menu except at Spaghetty Western. The capellini served al dente. Wow. They were channeling my grandfather.  It was so good. It tasted homemade and definitely made with care and by someone who loves food and how it tastes.  My girlfriend got penne (al dente , also) with pink vodka sauce and grilled chicken. The flavor was divine.  I had a glass of Chianti with my meal and the flavors of the sauce complimented my wine.    Without a doubt, this was one of the best and definitely one of my most favorite meals in  Vegas.

QJi-kt0a7LGlwWOyWbhbJg.text: Whether ordering a 4 cheese pizza, a linguine dish with seafood, or the infamous 'Bobbi' pasta dish- this place is a legit Italian restaurant.  Food is great and the live piano player is fab. We love Alex too.  You can't go wrong -- best local Italian restaurant in vegas!!

ssfD9QvecBotiNx2iHiPLQ.text: I thoroughly enjoyed my time here for dinner. We came in to see the Spaghetti Western movie posters on the walls and reminisced about the various movies (The Good, Bad, and the Ugly being our favorite).  The music playing in the background was something else too; Commodores, KC & Sunshine Band, MC Hammer, Queen, etc. Not your normal romantic music in the background - LOL.  I ordered the Pasta Carbonara with sausage. The portion was huge and had an awesome flavor. The noodles were perfectly cooked. Firm enough for flavor , yet soft enough to spin on your fork.   I also order a side of garlic bread with marinara sauce. This was a perfect compliment to the pasta.  For the price, this is/was an excellent value. It was flavorful and in huge portion. Definitely added to me "Go To" list of restaurants.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excellent price considering the flavor and huge portions.
Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic Bread with Marinara
Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Carbonara with sausage. Excellent flavor and portion.

wxtRXt0uoiD4QKFT3vbpmQ.text: The worse "Italian" (I use this word loosely) spot I ate in 2019 out of around 30.  Before I start I will say that the place is spotless, the service is top notch, the whole staff was friendly and accommodating.  I cannot say a bad word about anyone there (except the "chefs").  Italian Cooking 101: The most basic dish is spaghetti and meatballs.  Literally any establishment that has any worth should have a near perfect dish of this staple.  I ordered this dish and when it arrived in less than 10 minutes I was horrified at what I saw.  Their spaghetti is a touch thicker than what I would deem is the average size so cooking time due to thickness should be a touch longer.  However, the spaghetti was overcooked and the sauce was poured on top of it!?!?!  Seriously?  Has anyone at this place done the most basic beginner lessons in Italian cooking?  Spaghetti is suppose to ABSORB the sauce and should be tossed in it and not poured on top which causes the spaghetti to be uneven and has loads of water condensation at the bottom of the plate.  The plates bottom was covered in roughly 2 oz of watery liquid and this is so wrong.  It's freaking spaghetti and meatballs!  If you can't make the most basic dish in Italian cuisine than any dish that is even slightly more complicated would be worse.  I would personally be embarrassed if I served this dish to anyone at my house.  The sauce quality was ok to the taste but the ineptness of of marrying the pasta to sauce was comical.  I'll admit I'm not a big meatball guy but their's was ok.  I did not see the point of asking for anything else or having a redo because it would be pointless, the same exact dish would come out.  I did not complain, I paid my bill and tipped my waitress and left and don't see the point to come back ever.  Just trying to write a fair and honest review.

58NYmPFFKaRIzW90PJ3L7A.text: This place serves an amazing grilled shrimp carbonara! The shrimp is grilled to perfection and has that char to it. It's so good that my husband just wants an order of the grilled shrimp.   The pasta was cooked al dente. It had a lot of flavors and was so filling. It was a bit oily on the bottom which is why it was rated 4/5 but it was still very good.   Either drain the oil out or if you're like me and order from DoorDash or Uber eats, just switch the trays and that should help.   I have ordered this twice and it seems they are pretty consistent with this one. I would highly recommend.   They have officially bumped up to 5 stars!  I ordered meatballs and they were so tender and moist! Portion size amazing. I ordered the sausage and peppers, delicious! It was extremely flavorful and their caprese salad was delicious!

x6OVC5JbvCH1r4bLV1-rhw.text: Came here for lunch from the NW....a long drive but totally worth it!!! Lidia's lasagna is the best I've had in Vegas  Fried Mozzarella sticks, grilled octopus salad and the Porchetta sandwich rounded out our lunch   Food was very hearty and a great value and the staff was amazing   Can't wait to return again

eMPgAU0z3FGJukkLr6S5pA.text: We came here on Tuesday for dinner per my friend's recommendation. As stated in other reviews, the service is very slow. While it's a small restaurant and they probably manage on two-three wait staff it's at the detriment of the customer experience. That's a non-negotiable for me. Anywho, my friend arrived before me so she already had her drink. I finally ordered one and it took about 10 mins to get it even though I sat directly across from the bar. When I was ready to order a second glass, they were out :(    To support my point about service, we received our bread after our meal arrived. I had to ask a team member walking by to get it for us. On to the food, my friend ordered the chicken parmesan which she loves. I ordered the lobster ravioli which was good although I didn't love the sauce. We shared a Caesar salad which was good.   We decided to order dessert because my friend swears by their Tiramasu which I don't like so I opted for the cheesecake..... it was bad, like from your local grocer bad. Our very kind waiter was apologetic throughout the night and he comped dessert because they didn't have more of the wine I liked.   In the end, I will return because I enjoyed everything including the live music. The service is just not optimal for anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My friend&#39;s Tiramisu
Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu

8Ttio03LWa01cQshEWg7Og.text: I have been here a few times, but the last time was a revelation, I tried the Baked Mastaccioli. And let me tell you it will not disappoint.  It's the best dish by far!  Try it  Plenty of food for now and later.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M2h4mGSdn2NM7trQHO8wWg.text: Hubby wants to go out to dinner and lets me choose the venue.  I adore Italian so I surf Yelp and spy some great reviews.  But the title of "Spaghetty Western" is what caught my eye.  Charming, fun, thoughtful and ... Italian (!).  We arrived and enjoyed walking into a very NICE establishment.  Kinda busy but not in a crowded way, just the beginning of weekday dinner rush.  The large 3-page menu took a bit of time to choose from, as there were so many choices and combinations.  I chose to go simple with the basic spaghetti pasta, topped with house marinara and (3) meatballs, along with a glass of wine.  Husband chose the classic pasta with Carbonara sauce.  Our server was helpful, pleasant and seamlessly answered all of our dining questions.  While waiting for our dishes to be delivered, we noted and appreciated the warm decor, the framed and old-timey Spaghetti Western movie posters and the curious music in the background.   I say "curious" because I would put the music as disco era stuff but did not seem to "'match" the ambiance of the restaurant.  We were not complaining, mind you, as my husband and I are of an age that LIKES that type of music.  We just found it amusing as we sang along to a few of the songs.  Dinner arrived and woah (!) were my meatballs large.  I suppose I should not have eaten so much pre-meal warm bread slices, because I was not able to finish my delicious spaghetti.  The rest, I decided, had to go home with me.   Husband reports that the final bill for our meal tonight was appropriate for the amount and quality of food, as well as the outstanding service our gal gave us.  I would definitely be returning to this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the pages from the menu
Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. From the Classic Pasta page of the menu, here is the Spaghetty Meatballs dish

uzgEcbi8ElB5YGWX3Jqixw.text: This place has been around for 5 years, has expanded once, and is about to expand again! It's no wonder why, either. Their pastas are filled with rich flavor that explodes in your mouth. It is 100% recommended to try this place out.   Cowboy up and get your spaghetti on (or choose whatever noodle you want lol)!   We ordered the: Shrimp Scampi (which came with a large whole shrimp inside), Baked Mostaccioli, Carbonara with added grilled chicken, a Western salad, and some Garlic Bread!   10/10 would recommend.   *P.S. I am not giving a full 5 stars due to the service. Our waiter was very nice. They are just under staffed! For how busy the place was, they needed more help. I hope they expand on servers when they expand the restaurant itself!

rgVX3wsiJJj0lpHvsztrsw.text: This place was the best Italian food I've had in Las Vegas!! Omg so good!! The service was excellent too, we always had our drinks filled ! I ordered the lunch special which was a soup or salad with pasta of your choice. I picked Alfredo shrimp gnocchi and it was the best one I have ever had. I recommend everyone to try it. My boyfriend had the chicken Parm which was also delicious but he couldn't stop eating my gnocchi. Great Food reasonable prices.

A-tcJzVouQDs2-8poLtabw.text: This place is a little far for me since I live in the Northwest part of town but I will say it is totally worth the trip. We had the fried mozzarella which was crispy on the outside and so melty on the inside. For lunch I ordered Lidia's Lasagna which was the best I have ever had. Her sauce is AMAZING! And the portion is so big I could eat it for days. When we got here for lunch it had a nice crowd and the I love how the dining room is decorated. Will be back for sure!

TdOm7I67q-TVw13f5a2ksQ.text: My husband and I order delivery from this restaurant quite a bit. We dined in once, but didn't care for the environment. (It was very brightly lit and tables were crammed together with no booth options.) The red wine (Zinfandel which is all I drink) was quite pricy too and they only had one option.  Now, on to the food! Everything we have eaten here has been delicious. My favorite is eggplant Parmesan with veggies instead of pasta. The veggies are sauteed in olive oil and garlic, delish! The eggplant isn't heavily breaded like most eggplant parmesans which I love. The sauce is yummy as well. My husband likes to order pasta in a spicy arrabiata sauce, lasagna Bolognese, or a meatball appetizer. My favorite appetizer has to be the fried mozzarella! They make it fresh in-house,  it's lightly breaded, and delicious.   Although, we may never return to the restaurant in person, we will definitely continue to order delivery from this tasty restaurant.

zbxAsmVj9nAlkR-he9cL2w.text: I used to come here when they first open and just forgot about this place tucked in the corner.  Recently came here to celebrate a friends birthday and was shocked that they expanded. Like, wow! They had so much room for our party of 10 including 4 kids. Now that I have a baby of my own, I was happy to see that they had so much room for us. I thought it was gonna be crapped but, there was even enough room for our car seat/baby carriers.  Not only was there significant space for us, there was LIVE MUSIC *mind blown* and the guy was pretty good on his little keyboard. Playing Sinatra to John Legend to Queen.  I ordered the lasagna which was FAB!!!! Especially loved their garlic bread. As simple as it was, it was deliciously soft, buttery, and garlicky....that I wanted to order my own plate of them =)

5CyB_oB5Y8miyHhSdFkDAw.text: Great service and great food! I love their lunch special. $10.99 for a drink, side & entree.  I got a strawberry lemonade, veggie soup & baked mostaccioli. My sister got soda, garlic fries and spaghetti with meatballs.   There was plenty of leftovers, we both had 3 meals out of it.  Such a gem in the southern highlands area!

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xP7-cojxoQr0mm2hTI8n6w.text: Just happened to look for a local place near my brothers house and found Spaghetty Western. We weren't expecting much but I was totally wrong. I liked the place the second we walked through the door. It has a very inviting vibe.  We were seated in the back left corner of the restaurant, which was perfect for us because we overlooked the entire restaurant. Our server, Peggy, was the nicest, sweetest, coolest person. We had a great time with her during our visit. Thanks, Peggy!  I ordered the bruschetta as an appetizer and it was DELICIOUS! I devoured pretty much all of it and the olives that came with it. Then I ordered spaghetti and meatballs, which was delicious too. My Mother ordered a cheesesteak that was Really really good! We're originally from the Philadelphia area and know about the best cheese steaks known to humans. It's impossible to get an incredible Philly cheese steak anywhere else outside Philly and New Jersey, but the Spaghetty Western's cheesesteak was freakin' good.   I really love that this place also has an Italian deli. I'll definitely be back for that and for another meal. I want to try the other delicious looking items on the menu.   Go go go to Spaghetty Western. Bring an appetite! Great atmosphere, great staff and delicious foods. What could be better?

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mom in front of Spaghetty Western&#39;s delicious butchetta.

y2M3IBn_KoMFTuq-8mm6tw.text: Traditional Lasagna. Just do it.  I had that tonight and my wife had the spaghetti and meatballs. We had to wait about 30 minutes, it was well worth the wait.  I recommend reservations.

E3qYa0Hl49dJTB6xOfW3kA.text: We were craving Italian and it was our first time being at this restaurant. Staff was friendly and food was amazing. Chicken soup is a must, and we got full from appetizers could barely finish my main course. Desert was also delicious.Definitely going back for some more.

V9qqQeuSpY1kI8ELbbb5jw.text: One of my favorite Italian places in town, even though it changed owners & doesn't offer all of the same specialties as before. I've been going here occasionally since 2010.  They expanded the dining room so it's easier (but not too easy during peak times) to get a table. The menu has a good amount of items sure to please anyone's taste, and everything I've tried is delicious. You can tell they take their time to make the sauces from scratch & do the prep-work right. Many of the previous owner's recipes are still prepared pretty much as before & contain some cool NE Italian/Southwest fusion dishes (chili lasagne is amaze-balls) as well as traditional favorites (chicken pamesean is my litmus test for an Italian restaurant, and it is fantastic here).  It's really out of the way for me & most people living in the valley, but it's so good I like to make the trip when I can splurge on a nice meal (but don't want to pay strip prices either).   100t recommend.

TQOTthRNwxZjJwMXU4OGgg.text: I first ate at this hole in the neighborhood wall when it was a deli/eatery with real Italian from Italy staff.  I came back years later and it's totally different w a bar and no Italians from Italy w accents, Different looking cooks, and happy hour.  The charm of the deli eatery I loved is gone.  I ordered ravioli and tiramisu, my once favorites. I guess with enough alcohol everything is better.... except the memories.  Now I know why they offer points for you to eat here.  The service is not the same.

photos.caption: Photo of Spaghetty Western - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good looking chef, or so the ladies around me say

DJz9cd_CPmOKP6bnKlAMDQ.text: This food is fantastic! We have been here several times and can't get enough of it. The service is friendly, the food is always delicious and the atmosphere is quaint and comfortable. You'll love this place

JxPlTwvdhPvMVkCy-XCo_A.text: Delicious food and great atmosphere. The owner helps the staff and is super nice. I respect a place where the owner is involved and helping customers instead of telling people what to do. We couldn't be happier to find our new go to spot down the road from us with delicious fresh food.

qzVxzLYojDHQlmK_UVafAQ.text: Delicious pasta! I had the classic marinara and it was amazing! I called in a to go order and it was ready as soon as we got there! I just moved to this area and I'm so glad that I found a reasonably priced delicious pasta place! So glad we decided to check it out!

eIxnxp5J3Not6T9hGkbtZQ.text: Yum!  This place is always packed but the food is stellar and the service is great.  I highly recommend trying one of their fresh pastas.  Also they deliver so that's super.

ZR1XZcLTKCMI3tzt4Dy3ew.text: If you don't like authentic Italian food then skip this place, because they make the most amazing real Italian food. Been there a couple times, haven't food something on the menu I didn't love.

luqC-S-GKqUxgTYyuMTZ7w.text: We have both been here and has take out (they deliver)....and both times it has been great. I'm not fond of the pizza but the pasta and salads are awesome. Definitely fills your Italian fox when you don't feel like cooking

7eAxHdLjP6lzzzpTN7qqfA.text: Best meal I had since I moved to Las Vegas! !!!!! Fresh, and delicious ...friendly staff, and cozy place to dine in. Their fried calamari was exquisite, as well as the Risotto pescatore.

PpW661BQShykU8BzzN30DQ.text: By far the only True Italian food in Las Vegas.  This place beats any high end Italian restaurant on the STRIP. I'm born in raised in Manhattan and this is as good as it gets

1zLw4Mwn0om7nA6EQm77ig.text: So first time here.  Stopped in for lunch today a weekday at about noon nice little place clean and staff was very nice.  The reason why I'm only giving it 3 stars was I ordered the caprese  sandwich and really it wasn't worth it for $9.95  It was huge (even posted a shot of it) had great flavor to the balsamic and usual greens but really just one thick piece of Mozarella  cheese on it..just one. The  bad part about the sandwich  was the bread was very bready and very dried out so I ended up just leaving most of the bread on the plate.  Not sure how the cook could have not noticed that it was so dry and getting hard. hmmm. I could have mentioned the dried out bread (the main part of a sandwich) but I usually don't  make a stink in local places that are not chains. Kinda hoped they would have asked how everything  was but never did so I just let it pass.  However I did see everyone else getting some great looking pasta so next time I'm going to order that.  I really want to like this place I am going to return and give it another try. Order the Pasta would be my tip, wish I had  :(

mYQGDxgr_lcse3_Z5VsztA.text: This is a place to frequent often. The food is incredible. It is authentic Italian fresh made and it shows. You will not be disappointed. We tried 5 different dishes and every one was delicious. The shrimp scampi was the favorite dish of the table and the Mac and cheese was kid (and adult) approved!

9g0rtWvVuBdrtmRgUIktHw.text: Food is decent but when I call and am told 35 minutes for pasta, something is wrong. When I show up and  wait an extra 20 minutes, I'm pissed. Very disorganized, very unprofessional on the phone,  not worth it at all. Save yourself the headache go somewhere else.

6CuB9lfSW8Y9eMyDFmOiYQ.text: Yummy !!! The best Gravy I've had out west since New York, NY there going to be expanding very soon also . A little family owned hole in the wall .And we all know those are the best

U6BlcCMaugB69XeapTmRSQ.text: Had such a great meal here.  Small place and I hear they are going to expand soon.  Being from the east coast it's hard to find real good italian food in Vegas, but now I don't need to look any further. Calamari and sauce, excellent.  We had 5 drastically different meals and all of them were fresh, well made and delicious. We met one of the owners Pasquale, very nice guy.  Can't wait to go back.

Z9IDhH469j_FjHHGjxFIFw.text: Staff is friendly and the food is amazing! A little pricey on the food and alcohol but I'll survive.

lIcf91kCQFm6cV89_KN70w.text: If I could give 10 stars to this place, I would. The food is HANDS DOWN the best Italian I have had in my entire life.

dtnvh4X6PlRxo30p7Vv93Q.text: Great food and service for such a small place but well  worth it! I will be back! Thanks Joe!

5-WtUNzPxMpt3jFGtSPngw.text: I brought my mom and dad here for a late Saturday lunch.  I wish I could comment on the food but it was late December and they didn't have the heat on despite everyone in the restaurant having their coats on.  Being pregnant and hungry for pizza, my family decided to stick it out and stay there to eat with me since there are few options nearby.  I tried to ask or server and manager multiple times if they could turn the heat up, to which they replied, it takes a while.  The place didn't get one degree warmer the entire time my family ate there.  I couldn't even tell you how the food was that day.  We had a female bartender acting as our server and she couldn't seem to get anything to our table in a reasonable amount of time.  All around horrible experience.  There is nothing worst then eating while freezing, especially when the food is not cheap.  It should have been a nice family experience but we won't be back.  I'll go next door where they turn the heat on from now on.

kxHhGCjb4nPkwG21DW2rkg.text: Very good Italian food!  My wife and I were on vacation in Vegas and looking for something off the strip for dinner.  We found this place on Yelp, and we were very glad we did.   I had the chicken parmigiana sandwich...which was awesome!  My wife had the chicken Alfredo....also very good.  The staff was friendly and very helpful.  We would definitely go back!

_SRm96qcGHC-x3b-3u7-Wg.text: The best pasta ever!!!! I worked in a locally Italian owned pasta place growing up, I thought it was the best. Til I had this places food. Small place very busy. I've always gotten my food to go. I can see y it's always busy tho delicious!!!!! Angel hair pasta ala vodka sauce. idk I'm not Italian

j9CTBUQVTVAgwwEVS-7dGA.text: First, to address the negative comments about the female server: people have bad days and some can't handle stress as well as others. At times she seemed distracted, but she has little help with a full dining room. To add to this: most regulars seemed to expect her to drop everything and help them. Be patient, people...and lighten up! She knew all of the regulars and knew what they ordered in the past. That's not easy to keep track of! She was awesome with our 3 year old, knew the menu and was able to make awesome suggestions for us. BONUS. The food was amazing. We had the antipasto plate...the meats were incredible and I'm a prosciutto SNOB! We also ordered entrees (5 of us total)...there were NO complaints. There was enough food for each of us to take home and enjoy again for lunch the next day.  If you are a gnocchi fan, I highly recommend it! I had it with pink vodka sauce and it was de-lish.  The thing I really didn't like about this place was the marks the chair left on my legs. The seating is not comfy - it is more for deli-seating...in and out. If you want to relax and have a drink with dinner, you may want to take the food to go. If they had different chairs, non-wicker type, 5 stars for sure.  This is a 5-star to go place!!

3YX9UvWItOg0103HuH4oQQ.text: Service is spotty, ordered and waited a long time. Got home and food was greasy, my husband had been before and loved the meatball sub so we thought it would be great.  I was so hoping it would be but I'm let down.  Will try again in a few months.

o-jR4lp3XSKGEwy-k45uFg.text: This place was fantastic! Fresh pasta daily, tortellini soup was light and flavored perfectly. Caprese salad was the best I've ever had! We also had the Diablo pasta which had just enough spice to give it a kick but not be overly hot. Great laid back, family atmosphere. Will definitely be coming back here again and again!
